message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of fast user detection and channel state information acquisition in millimeter wave (mmWave) cellular systems. This involves the use of compressed sensing techniques for channel estimation and pilot assignment/reuse for mobile users. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory), which deals with the mathematical foundations of information processing, including signal processing, coding theory, and data compression. Other likely sub-categories include cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.MM (Multimedia), and cs.LG (Machine Learning). These sub-categories are relevant because the paper also deals with the design of pilot schemes and channel estimators for mmWave networks, which involve network architecture, social networks, multimedia data, and machine learning techniques.
